name: Old Faithful Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: My new favorite place!
reviews.title: The best place to stay in the park
Old & Perfect
reviews.text: We stayed here one night in a simple room, no bath and were a bit worried before arrival. But we were pleasantly surprised. The room on the top floor was very cozy and renovated. The bathrooms are right outside on the hallway and are completely remodeled as well. We sat on the balcony of the lobby, listened to piano music, had drinks form the bar and relaxed after a long day of visiting the park. We had the buffet dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Make reservations early, it fills up quickly! The buffet is worth the price (~$30 pp) and the staff was very nice. A great stay and we would have stayed longer, but everything was booked out the next night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since we were going in September we managed to stay in this historic property for 3 different days. We loved it. We stayed in the old original building built in 1903. It was perfect. If you don't like historic hotels this may not be for you. There is no air conditioning, TV, and most of the old original rooms have no private bath. We could hear our neighbors through the walls but we loved it. I am not usually one to choose historic over comfort but this place is incredible. It has ambience, charm, and location, location, location. The bonus is the old original rooms without baths are also cheap. If you travel for the experience, this is one not to be missed. Besides the hotel itself we saw 7 different geysers erupt in one day and 5 we walked to from the Inn. The first day we got here the buffalo were blocking the road in. This has been an incredible experience.
reviews.title: Freezing night in the Old Faithful Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the old rooms in the Inn on 13th September. The radiator valve was stuck and the maintenance man on duty that night couldn't fix it so our room was absolutely freezing. At midnight, Housekeeping provided some extra blankets but they were no substitute for a warm room and we didn't sleep at all well. In the morning, a different maintenance man fixed the problem in a few minutes.
reviews.title: A Great Historic Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Considering I had booked the room (together with two others) the previous February for a family reunion for my birthday, it was a very disappointing experience. The other rooms were not without their problems - faulty lock, blown lightbulbs.
reviews.title: bring a heater

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We decided to spend 1 night in each area instead of doing a lot of driving and it worked out well so we came in the western entrance and started here. I reserved a room and requested a bathroom. I was given a mid range room. I did not realize that there was no shower. The bathroom (which I think was bigger and brighter than the bedroom) had a clawfoot tub for just baths or you could use it to shower your self but will get water all over the room. Maybe that is why the bathroom is so big. Otherwise, there are showers in the hallway bathroom. The light in the tiny bedroom is a joke. You cannot read anything in the bedroom because the light is just not bright enough. If you plan to read yourself to sleep, you need to bring a flashlight on vacation or plan to sleep in the bathroom. Otherwise, the Inn atmosphere is very nice. Food was good but expensive. This is the case
reviews.title: Lovely Inn but bring a flaslight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: throughout Yellowstone. All of the wait staff are part of an international exchange program so they practice their english. This is the case throughout the Yellowstone restaurants. The geysers erupts every 90 min.
reviews.title: Beautiful but poorly run

likes.liked: — location, fun lobby with lots of room for hanging out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So far as hotels in the park, this was our favorite, if only because the old part of it was so amazing. Luckily we were staying in a new part, so our rooms were miniscule but at least more modern with bathrooms. They made the size problem worse by trying to cram too much furniture into them - who needs a desk when you can't walk between it and your bed?
reviews.title: Don't eat here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was really surprising was how incompetent the front desk staff were. They were friendly and tried to be helpful, but it seemed they were encumbered by a poorly understood computer system. It took many tries to properly change our reservations, and they never could figure out how to split a bill for two rooms. It was early in the season, but it wasn't an unusual request I would think.
reviews.title: Be forewarned: Read the worst reviews and believe them

likes.liked: — It was a roof over our heads, and convenient to various spots in the park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For one of the grand dames of national park lodging our stay was bit of a let down. The old part of the lodge was great, something out of your dreams. The front desk was warm and efficient. The housekeeping staff was marginal at best. Out of country staff thinking about when they could return home. Last and worst,
reviews.title: Over rated!!!

likes.disliked: — price, condition of rooms, poor staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked late and consider ourselves fortunate to have gotten anything in the Inn--in this case the cheapest of the rooms with private bath, located far down some less than attractive corridors. But no matter--we were happy to be there, surrounded by such powerful forces of nature. The room was small and basic, with a hard bed and formed plastic shower. We didn't use the car an entire day as we explored on foot the extensive Old Faithful Basin area. We saw all but one of the predicted eruptions (missed due to dinner reservation) and enjoyed the bison that roam the area. The guided tour of the Inn is well worth it.
reviews.title: Great to be on site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinner in the Inn's dining room was excellent and we also had a fine breakfast buffet there. I found the cafeteria food salty.
reviews.title: Historic but jaded

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Admittedly booked late and given last room in hotel but it was so jaded (furniture and decor). Corridors also look shabby. There's a real sense of history and the opportunity to see the Old Faithful geyser is brilliant. Restaurant was poor and expensive, but queues every night leading to mass catering feel. However, we spoke to several people who would have sacrificed quality for their accommodation outside the Park (30 mile drive). Good to stay close to Old Faithful geyser but not good to stay for more than a couple of days. Perhaps it would be good to check room standards.
reviews.title: great hotel in one of a kind natural wonder place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed in their high range room for one night at the end of August. We were quite pleased with the room which greatly exceeded our expectation. Originally I wanted to book a room at old faithful snow lodge based on the reviews but was not successful since I made a late reservation (1 ½ months before arrival). There was only high range room at Old Faithful Inn available at the time I called. The room rate was $242 per night. I had to go with it since I didn’t have other choice. Because of those mixed reviews (most of them were kind of negative about this place), I was quite concerned before we got there. However, our room was very spacious, clean and simple. From our window, we could see the old faithful geyser, what a view! We enjoyed our diner at the dining room. Also had wonderful time relaxing and having some drinks in the outdoor patio and lobby. We were very impressed by the architecture of this place, it is one of a kind!
reviews.title: It might be right for you...

likes.liked: — the history and access to natural wonders
likes.disliked: — Nothing much. Could have used more light in the hallways of the original structure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I gave it 9 out of 10 score.
reviews.title: Old Faithful Inn Great history/atmosphere, average stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We stayed in the Old faithful Inn for 2 nights and it was nice - nothing spectacular but nice.
reviews.title: Nice place but a bit busy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food in the restaurant was expensive but we discovered that if you go out of the hotel and turn left - head towards the gas station there is a shop with a nice diner at the back - they cook good basic food and it was delicious - we also went there for breakfast which was great. we enjoyed looking at the geysers but there was not that much wildlife around.
reviews.title: Wonderful atmosphere but could use a few updates.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am a little late in posting a review,but I thought I would share our experience.We arrived around 5 pm .It was a treat driving into the park against traffic,everyone coming out and we were on our way in.We were shocked at the traffic leaving the park and how empty our lane was going into the park.
reviews.title: Nice atmosphere but the service doesn't match

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge was as beautiful and nostalgic as we expected.
reviews.title: Old log inn

likes.disliked: — No facilities. Shared with critters. Small room and little insulation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a room in the east wing it was just ok.
reviews.title: Loved quiet moments in charming inn

likes.liked: — The charm of the lodge, how quiet it was at the end of the day, fantastic location for viewing geysers
likes.disliked: — During the day the area is very busy, but nothing I didn't expect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here and it was about what I'd expected, having read all the reviews. The rooms are small--we were in a backside East wing room with a view of the staff work area. But beyond that was a lovely view of the mountains. Very clean and housekeeping did a good job keeping it so. The queen size bed was ok, but short-sheeted. What's the deal here? When you commit to purchaing a larger bed, shouldn't you purchase linens that fit? The dining room is gorgeous and our dinners were very nice. Great servers who really did a good job and knew their menus. Breakfast, however, is another story. Extremely poor service--skip this place and find another spot! It was nice to have cellular reception here, just to check messages from home. But I didn't miss television or internet!
reviews.title: Historic ambiance and a tad overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great place to visit, but I would never stay here again. The Snow Lodge which is located right behind The Old Faithful Inn has been remodeled and not crowded. The restaurant at Snow Lodge far surpassed the food and service that we had on the first night at the Inn. We were supposed to have dinner there two nights, but opted for Snow Lodge instead. We were dining late and decided to share a dinner. The server delivered our trimmed prime rib and baked potato, perfectly divided on two plates. Great service.
reviews.title: Nice place to visit, but I wouldn't stay here!

likes.liked: — Proximity to the Old Faithful Geyser

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were trying to get an early start to the Lamar Valley and we were at the front desk at 6AM and another guest was complaining about a rodent problem!
reviews.title: Stay away from the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I actually stayed at the Old Faithful Snow Lodge but had dinner at the Old Faithful dining room. It was absolutely horrible (and my husband and I are not that picky). First, the appetizer was some kind of cold salmon dish and tasted awful. My husband said he wouldn't even give it to our dogs. But hey, sometimes you just get a bad appetizer, so we decided to forget it and order our main dishes. When we asked our waitress a question about one of the items, she didn't know the answer and never made any kind of effort to ask someone else to get the answer, so we just went ahead and ordered the item anyway. The main dishes were not as bad as the appetizer, but certainly not worth upwards of $30.00 a plate. It was very mediocre food and not worth the price. We were very disappointed upon leaving, but at least we got to see the Inn itself. Our advice: stop in to see the Inn (because it is beautiful), but have an early dinner SOMEWHERE ELSE and then spend the early evening having drinks and listening to the live piano music while sitting next to a fireplace. The piano music stops at 10 pm., so be sure to get in there before 9 as it as so relaxing. Don't waste your money in the restaurant, though.
reviews.title: Great location, great lodge, great food! Rooms...eh.

likes.liked: — The awesome lobby with it's fireplace and places to hang out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The best place of this inn is the lobby. I wish I lived in it! It is like a great old log lodge with great little nooks for getting together on multifloors where you can look down and watch the people below and the fireplace. There are upper decks outside to watch Old Faithful. They have lots of couches and groups of chairs where you can relax but still see the fireplace. There's also reading areas and computer areas on the upper floors. We also had Christmas in August. Yep, Santa was there and a tree. The food is the best I have ever had in a national park. Dinner was amazing. Best wild salmon I ever had. They had a buffet for breakfast, but we ordered off the menu and it was also great. You need to beware when booking because not all rooms have their own bathrooms and you will see people walking around in robes because of that. We were also charged a lot of money for a room with a view of Old Faithful and all we saw was a tree. We also had to share a full-sized bed which was difficult for us because we have a king. Other than the lack of sleep the place is great!
reviews.title: The Inn is wonderful
Do not stay here
reviews.text: So what are you’re choices? Where else can you stay and see geysers, bears, and bison in a day. The accommodations are one star and minimalistic. The lodge is amazing; it is old and historic. There are few rooms with private toilets and showers, but the bathrooms are clean. The beds and pillows are just OK. Each room does have a sink, some toiletries are provided, the towels are acceptable and a robe is provided. Our double queen room was on the third floor overlooking the front of the hotel. It was very noisy except from 2 am- 6:30 am. There was a crane worker sealing the windows from 7 am- 7 pm, so you heard beeping all the time outside. The walls are paper thin and if someone is talking in the next room you can hear every word. There are no TVs or phones, no WIFI, no computers, you are really isolated. Your cell phone will work, so text messaging was an option, as well as phone calls. The food is acceptable, as is the wine selection, just do not expect Starbucks quality or gourmet food. If you want to see this part of the park; this is the only choice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This inn is a classic...I stayed here with my parents on a family vacation in 1969 (and I think in the same room). What I did not know when booking this was that there's "old house" (original area) rooms and west wing "high range" rooms and they are not at all alike. The rooms I thought we'd be in were in the historic part and full of logs down dark wooded hallways. The room we got was comfortable but kind of sterile like a hospital room with exposed pipes throughout. Some of the historic rooms do not have bathrooms, so that's something to watch for while making reservations, too.
reviews.title: Magical place...will stay in old house area next time

likes.disliked: — The more modern area where our rooms were located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the somewhat disappointing location of our room, it did little to dim the excitement of being right there in that grand old lobby, people watching, and enjoying writing a love note to my husband on one of the several old fashioned writing desks around the balcony areas. We watched Old Faithful erupt in the mooonlight and saw bison in the parking lot in the morning all with frosted fur.
reviews.title: Enjoyable dining and suite reservations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: You can't sit in the lobby for long without feeling the timelessness of this place...we'll be back...just in the Old House part!
reviews.title: Pleasant but slightly overpriced, dim room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to get an almost-last minute reservation for one night only here, and one night at the Snow Lodge (separate review). We had a room in the newer part that cost over $200. The room was spacious and had two double beds, an armoire, table, chairs and coffee maker. The bathroom was non descript and the tub and toilet were either permanently stained or maybe not real clean?? But you are staying right in the park, for heaven's sake!!! That's why you do it - the fantastic ambiance, the history, and the chance to have the park right outside your door. I'd stay here again for a night or two, but then move to a cheaper place in one of the surrounding communities. In fact, we stayed in Gardiner at the Super 8 for two nights and it was great.
reviews.title: Lots of atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the food and atmosphere in the restaurant, but I would agree with other comments on this site that it is good to view this hotel - the lobby is amazing - but to stay elsewhere.
reviews.title: One Night was enough!

aka: Old Faithful Hotel Yellowstone National Park
